name: paper-input-decorator

attributes.name: label
attributes.description:
The label for this input. It normally appears as grey text inside
the text input and disappears once the user enters text.

attributes.name: floatingLabel
attributes.description:
If true, the label will "float" above the text input once the
user enters text instead of disappearing.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Set to true to style the element as disabled.

attributes.name: labelVisible
attributes.description:
Use this property to override the automatic label visibility.
If this property is set to `true` or `false`, the label visibility
will respect this value instead of be based on whether there is
a non-null value in the input.

attributes.name: isInvalid
attributes.description: Set this property to true to show the error message.

attributes.name: autoValidate
attributes.description:
Set this property to true to validate the input as the user types.
This will not validate when changing the input programmatically; call
`validate()` instead.

attributes.name: error
attributes.description:
The message to display if the input value fails validation. If this
is unset or the empty string, a default message is displayed depending
on the type of validation error.

methods.name: validate
methods.description: Validate the input using HTML5 Constraints.

return.description: True if the input is valid.

methods.name: updateLabelVisibility
methods.description:
Updates the label visibility based on a value. This is handled automatically
if the user is typing, but if you imperatively set the input value you need
to call this function.
